intro: Sisymbrium nuttallii, commonly known as Nuttall's brookweed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant typically grows in moist, disturbed soils along stream banks and roadsides. It has small, yellow flowers that bloom in early spring, and its leaves are alternate, pinnately lobed. Sisymbrium nuttallii is often found in wet meadows and is adapted to environments with high water content.
